intro: Myosotis scouleri, commonly known as the mountain forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white down, giving it a soft appearance. Myosotis scouleri is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
